Actions.ActionName: Execute AppleScript to get all RegEx sets that match searchToken
Actions.Text:
----------------------------------------------------------# Author:			Chris Thomerson (@cdthomer)## Current Version:	1.0 (Initial script)# Version History:		1.0 (Initial script)## Created:			Tuesday, February 8, 2022# Modified:			Tuesday, February 8, 2022# macOS:			11.6.3 (Big Sur)# Tags:				Typinator## DISCLAIMER# Permission to use, copy, modify, and/or distribute this# software for any purpose with or without fee is hereby granted.## THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL# WARRANTIES WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED# WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL# THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR# CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM# LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT,# NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN# CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.----------------------------------------------------------# set searchToken to "LB"
	### REQUIRES KEYBOARD MAESTRO 8.0.3+ ###
	set KMINST to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"
	tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"
		set searchToken to getvariable "local__searchToken" instance KMINST
	end telltell application "Typinator"	set regexSets to ""	repeat with theSet in rule sets		if rule type of theSet is regular expression rules then			if name of theSet contains searchToken then				set regexSets to regexSets & name of theSet & "|"			end if		end if	end repeat	return regexSetsend tell

Actions.ActionName: Set variables to be used in AppleScript according to front screen

ElseActions.ActionName: Search Variable “Typinator_screenRes” to get resolution variables for second screen

ThenActions.ActionName: Search Variable “Typinator_screenRes” to get resolution variables for main screen

Actions.Title: Insert required information
Actions.ActionName: Prompt for set name, abbreviation and expansion
Actions.Prompt: Select Set Name and then add the abbreviation using RegEx format as well as the expansion you would like to be produced.

ThenActions.ActionName: Repeat prompt until abbreviation contains line separators

Actions.Title: It appears your RegEx is missing line separators
Actions.ActionName: Prompt for user to correct string
Actions.Prompt:
Please adjust your RegEx below.
Each string should be separated by a line separator... |

Actions.ActionName: Ensure abbreviation is wrapped in RegEx parenthesis
Execute AppleScript to add expression to Typinator
Actions.Text: ----------------------------------------------------------# Author:			Chris Thomerson (@cdthomer)## Current Version:	1.0 (Initial script)# Version History:		1.0 (Initial script)## Created:			Monday, February 7, 2022# Modified:			Monday, February 7, 2022# macOS:			11.5.2 (Big Sur), 12.1 (Monterey)# Tags:					## DISCLAIMER# Permission to use, copy, modify, and/or distribute this# software for any purpose with or without fee is hereby granted.## THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND THE AUTHOR DISCLAIMS ALL# WARRANTIES WITH REGARD TO THIS SOFTWARE INCLUDING ALL IMPLIED# WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS. IN NO EVENT SHALL# THE AUTHOR BE LIABLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, OR# CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR ANY DAMAGES WHATSOEVER RESULTING FROM# LOSS OF USE, DATA OR PROFITS, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT,# NEGLIGENCE OR OTHER TORTIOUS ACTION, ARISING OUT OF OR IN# CONNECTION WITH THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS SOFTWARE.------------------------------------------------------------set AppleScript variablesset winName to "Create new Typinator Item"### Requires Keyboard Maestro 8.0.3+ ###set kmInst to system attribute "KMINSTANCE"tell application "Keyboard Maestro Engine"	set xRes to getvariable "local__xRes" instance kmInst	set yRes to getvariable "local__yRes" instance kmInst	set setName to getvariable "local__Set Name" instance kmInst	set abbreviation to getvariable "local__Abbreviation" instance kmInst	set expansion to getvariable "local__Expansion" instance kmInstend tell--create a new entry from clipboardtell application "Typinator"	create from clipboardend telltell application "System Events"	tell application process "Typinator"				--wait until the Typinator window appears		repeat until window winName exists			delay 0.1		end repeat				--set Typinator window position		tell window winName			set winSize to its size			set winXsize to item 1 of winSize			set winYsize to item 2 of winSize			set its position to {(xRes - winXsize) / 2, (yRes - winYsize) / 2}		end tell				--wait until the set menu appears		repeat until pop up button 1 of window winName exists			delay 0.1		end repeat				if value of pop up button 1 of window winName is setName then						--do nothing if current set is already correct auto correction					else						--click the set menu			click pop up button 1 of window winName						--wait until auto correction is in the menu			repeat until menu item setName of menu 1 of pop up button 1 of window winName exists				delay 0.1			end repeat						--select the auto correction menu item			click menu item setName of menu 1 of pop up button 1 of window winName					end if				set value of attribute "AXValue" of text field 1 of group 1 of window "Create new Typinator Item" to abbreviation --sets value of Abbreviation field to KM variable		set value of attribute "AXValue" of text area 1 of scroll area 1 of group 1 of window "Create new Typinator Item" to expansion --sets value of Expansion field to KM variable				--ensures the abbreviation field has been set		repeat until value of attribute "AXValue" of text field 1 of group 1 of window "Create new Typinator Item" is abbreviation			delay 0.1		end repeat				--ensures the expansion field has been set		repeat until value of attribute "AXValue" of text area 1 of scroll area 1 of group 1 of window "Create new Typinator Item" is expansion			delay 0.1		end repeat				--clicks the Add button		click button "Add" of window "Create new Typinator Item"			end tellend tell
